department: Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness Canada
description: Description of the Requirement: The objective of this requirement is to have senior, intermediate and junior procurement specialists, on an as-and-when-requested basis as defined through task authorizations, support both the Contracting Procurement Unit (CPU) deliver its mandate and the various branches and groups throughout the department in the development of their requirements by developing statements of work (SOW) and evaluation criteria. Although the work completed under this contract will either be for the CPU or the branches (the ‘Client’), all contracts and subsequent TAs will be managed by the CPU. There will be three streams of Procurement Specialists under each contract: Stream 1: Operational support for the Contracting and Procurement Unit Stream 2: Client support to identify and develop procurement requirements Stream 3: Policy support to develop procurement policies, tools and training Category:3.7: Procurement Specialist The following companies have been invited to submit a proposal. Accenture Adirondack Information Management Inc., The AIM group Inc in Joint venture (indigenous) Altis Human Resources Contract Community Inc., Nisha Technologies in Joint Venture Deloitte Inc KPMG Lumina IT Inc Orbis Risk Consulting Inc. (indigenous) QMR Staffing Solutions The Right Door Consulting & Solutions6137318 Canada Inc ADGA Group Consultants Inc Fleetway Inc Koroc Consulting Inc., Isheva Inc. in Joint Venture Maplestream Inc., Cofomo Ottawa Inc., in Joint Venture Level of Security Requirement: Common Security Requirements Checklist: SRCL #19 Company Minimum Security Level Required: Designated Organizational Screening, Secret Resource Minimum Security Level Required: Reliability/Secret Proposed period of contract: The Work is to be performed from the date of contract award to April 30, 2025, inclusively. The Contractor grants to Canada the irrevocable option to extend the term of the Contract by up to one additional two-year period under the same conditions. NOTE: The Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) Method of Supply is subject to quarterly refresh cycles. If you wish to find out how you can be a “Qualified SA Holder”, please contact SPTS. TSPS@TPSGC-PWGSC.GC.CA
